content:
guys are there any fast way to run tests? :(
when I run ./x.py test --bless src/test/ui --test-args=const-evaluating to just run one test, it takes too much time to compile then run test
it is really frustrating :(
Unfortunately for running tests we need a full compiler, so I don't think there are any shortcurts for that specific use case
@hossein dindar CI should have printed the diff of the tests that failed, try copy/pasting that and applying it locally with git apply?
@Joshua Nelson you mean that I pick the correct .stderr files content from CI failed tests result and copy/paste them in that files locally?
tedious, but might be faster than waiting for rustc_middle :/
yeah absolutely, ok let me check, thanks
